bibl.title: Queen, Harlot or Lecherous Goddess? An Egyptological Approach to a Roman Image of Propaganda.
bibl.note: Moulded lamps showing a naked woman squatting on a phallus set on the back of a crocodile show probably the wide diffusion of the propaganda against Isiac religion and against Cleopatra.
bibl.seg: ÉTIENNE Marc, Queen, Harlot or Lecherous Goddess? An Egyptological Approach to a Roman Image of Propaganda.
Susan WALKER and Sally-Ann ASHTON (Edd.), Cleopatra Reassessed = The British Museum Occasional Paper. 103 (London, 2003) pp. 95-100, 3 figg.
Moulded lamps showing a naked woman squatting on a phallus set on the back of a crocodile show probably the wide diffusion of the propaganda against Isiac religion and against Cleopatra.
